summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York regarding scheduling a meeting on August 19, 2019, for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors. The emails discuss travel arrangements and the client's decision-making process about coming forward.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide information.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Allred's assistant who is to be contacted by federal agents to arrange travel details for the client.

connections.description: Allred instructs the federal agent to contact her assistant, Diane Aldrich, to arrange travel details for her client.
Attorney-client coordination where Allred is arranging for her client (an Epstein victim) to meet with federal prosecutors for an interview.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Epstein victim
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, at 2 p.m. at the prosecutor's office for Gloria Allred's client, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: Gloria Allred was representing a client who was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and was coordinating with federal prosecutors for the client to provide information.
A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, at 2 p.m. at the prosecutor's office in the Southern District of New York.
Travel arrangements for the client were to be coordinated through Allred's assistant, Diane Aldrich, with a federal agent handling travel.
The emails reveal the sensitive and confidential nature of victim cooperation, including one client initially deciding not to meet before another agreed.
The correspondence highlights the ongoing federal investigation into Epstein following his 2019 arrest, with prosecutors actively seeking victim testimony.
